feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 6:44PM AKDT until March 19 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Northwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Kodiak Island. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 5:08PM AKDT until March 19 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow occurring. Visibilities reduced to one half mile or less at times. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts as high as 50 mph.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 18 at 3:40PM AKDT until March 19 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 40 below expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast. * WHEN...6 PM this evening to noon Saturday.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility and cold wind chills occuring. Plan on areas of poor visibilities to create difficult travel conditions at times. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued March 18 at 11:20AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PM-10 HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR THE YUMA AREA SUNDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued a PM-10 High Pollution Advisory for the Yuma area on Sunday. An episode of strong and gusty winds is forecast to generate widespread blowing dust that may result in local PM-10 concentrations that pose a health risk. Adverse health effects

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 2:41PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MODEST SYSTEM WITH SHOWERS AND INCREASED WINDS THIS WEEKEND... A fast moving storm system will move across the region Saturday into early Sunday, bringing breezy winds with chances for rain and snow showers Saturday into Saturday evening, followed by chilly conditions with brisk northwest to north winds Sunday. * SNOW: Projected snowfall amounts are up to 3 inches above 5000
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 2:01PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: A cold front will move through the area Saturday night into Sunday bringing rain/snow and windy conditions. For the Snake Plain, 1 to 4 inches of snow is possible with this system. 1 to 2 inches is the most likely range. The higher amounts of 3 and 4 inches are not as likely with very low confidence for this to occur. Snow levels start high, 6000 to 6500
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain

entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves between 6 to 8 feet. * WHERE...Beaches across the northwest to northeast and southeast coasts of Puerto Rico, as well as all beaches of Culebra and St Croix.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 8:05PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WET SNOW CONTINUES ACROSS EAST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN TONIGHT... Periods of snow will continue overnight through Saturday morning. Above freezing temperatures near the surface will still allow for rain at times before midnight, but mainly snow is expected late tonight as temperatures slowly decrease. The above freezing temperatures have also allowed much of the falling snow to melt
